intro: Cissampelos owariensis, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, waxy berries that are typically orange or red in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
